title: String IP address to HEX IP address

data.title: String IP address to HEX IP address
data.statement:
You have to write a program that takes a string form of an IP address e.g. {{10.25.210.27}} and return an array with four 8 bit byes and only four bytes in hexadecimal format enclosed in brackets like this: {{{0x0A, 0x19, 0xD2, 0x1B}}} , the output of the hexadecimal numbers has to be in uppercase.
Make sure to check that only numbers are admitted on each field.

testCases.title: Test 3 invalid IP (more than 4 fields and text with numbers)

data.inputDescription: A string [[IPaddr]] containing an IP address separated by a dot character.
data.outputDescription:
The function has to return an array of integers in the range of 0-255 in hexadecimal format as described in the statement.
If any of the fields at the input string has a number out of the range 0-255, more than 4 fields and letters with numbers in any field then it should output the error {{Invalid IP address format!}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to write a program that takes a string form of an IP address e.g. 10.25.210.27 and return an array with four 8 bit byes and only four bytes in hexadecimal format enclosed in brackets like this: {0x0A, 0x19, 0xD2, 0x1B} , the output of the hexadecimal numbers has to be in uppercase.
Make sure to check that only numbers are admitted on each field.
Input
A string IPaddr containing an IP address separated by a dot character.
Output
The function has to return an array of integers in the range of 0-255 in hexadecimal format as described in the statement.
If any of the fields at the input string has a number out of the range 0-255, more than 4 fields and letters with numbers in any field then it should output the error Invalid IP address format!
Constraints
Example
Input
255.255.255.0
Output
{0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00}
